snippet: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, the archbishop of the Roman Catholic Church in New York, tried to emphasize the positive in his meetings Monday with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and legislative leaders.
abstract: Cardinal Timothy M Dolan, the archbishop of the Roman Catholic Church in New York, emphasizes the positive, and not ideological differences, while visiting New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and legislative leaders in Albany.
lead_paragraph: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, the archbishop of the Roman Catholic Church in New York, tried to emphasize the positive in his meetings Monday with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and legislative leaders.

headline.seo: In Albany, Cardinal Timothy Dolan Is Friendly Yet Concerned
headline.main: On Eve of Albany Policy Push, Cardinal Focuses on Good Will
headline.print_headline: On Eve of Albany Policy Push, Cardinal Focuses on Good Will
